name: matriculation
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the process of formally becoming a student at a university or college, or the ceremony at which this happens: At the matriculation ceremony, we all had to walk through the streets of Oxford wearing short black gowns. The report found an 11% increase in college matriculation. See
matriculate
More examplesFewer examplesFollowing his matriculation at Cambridge he was awarded a fellowship in classics.He was expelled from school, but was allowed to sit the matriculation examinations. It is 31 years since the class posed for their matriculation photograph.
